pullRequest.title: Arnej/use global filter in nn blueprint
pullRequest.bodyText:
I confirm that this contribution is made under the terms of the license found in the root directory of this repository's source tree and that I have the authority necessary to make this contribution on behalf of its copyright owner.
@geirst @toregge @havardpe please take a look

commit.message: use global filter in NN blueprint
own the filter in a class and use shared_from_this

nodes.bodyText: global filter should be const here
just use ctor_tag() instead of x

nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -0,0 +1,38 @@
+// Copyright Verizon Media. Licensed under the terms of the Apache 2.0 license. See LICENSE in the project root.
+
+#pragma once
+
+#include <memory>
+#include <vespa/searchlib/common/bitvector.h>
+
+namespace search::queryeval {
+
+class GlobalFilter : public std::enable_shared_from_this<GlobalFilter>

nodes.bodyText: We should create a unit test for what happens when the global filter is considered. Should be sufficient to test the estimate result on the blueprint, and whether we are still approximate or not.
This threshold should probably be configurable, but that we can do in a later PR.

commit.message: unit test blueprint's handling of global filter

nodes.bodyText: For consideration: To make the tests easier to read I would prefer having one test function for each of the 3 cases tested, and move the common setup (tensor content + blueprint) to a fixture that could inherit DenseTensorAttributeMockIndex.
